intro: Evelyna kermesina var. aurantiaca-simplex, commonly known as the golden-simplicity kermesina, is a rare and striking plant characterized by its vibrant, orange-red foliage. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically green or yellow, contrasting with its bold leaves. Its unique coloration makes it a sought-after specimen in botanical gardens and private collections. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered endangered and requires careful conservation efforts.
